metadata.title: CVE-2024-2612 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
If an attacker could find a way to trigger a particular code path in`SafeRefPtr`, it could have triggered a crash or potentially be leveragedto achieve code execution. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 124,Firefox ESR < 115.9, and Thunderbird < 115.9.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-2612` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 124.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 124.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 124.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:115.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:115.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:115.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:115.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:115.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:115.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '124.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:115.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
